intro: Ceropegia namuliensis, commonly known as the Namuli ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mozambique. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid conditions. Its flowers are often pale green or yellowish, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Ceropegia namuliensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
